text.section: The Authority shall administer the Fund.

section.section: The Fund is a special, nonlapsing fund that is not subject to reversion under § 7-302 of the State Finance and Procurement Article.
The Treasurer shall hold the Fund separately, and the Comptroller shall account for the Fund.

text.section:
The Fund shall be self-sustaining and shall achieve investment returns on its portfolio in the form of:
royalties from enterprises in amounts to be determined by the Authority; and
interest payments from any debt securities.
As needed for the Program, the Authority may withdraw from time to time up to a total of $2,000,000 from the Small Business Development Guaranty Fund and deposit the withdrawal into the Fund.

section.section: The Treasurer shall invest the money of the Fund in the same manner as other State money may be invested.
Any investment earnings of the Fund shall be paid into the Fund.

text.section: On or before December 31 of each year, the Authority shall submit a report on the Program to the General Assembly in accordance with § 2-1246 of the State Government Article.
